pageContext.claim: “There are now 77 major or significant Walls built around the world, with 45 countries planning or building Walls. Over 800 miles of Walls have been built in Europe since only 2015. They have all been recognized as close to 100% successful. Stop the crime at our Southern Border!”
pageContext.analysis: Everything in this tweet is off. According to the New York Times, it's not 77 but 70 walls; Europe has added 600 miles or so of new walls since 2015, not 800; these walls are not like Trump's proposed concrete or steel designs; and they are hardly recognized to be "100% successful." Trump exaggerates with his claim of "crime at our Southern Border." There is no established link between immigration and higher crime, and crime rates along the border are toward the lower ends nationwide. McAllen, Tex., for example, calls itself the "seventh safest city in America."
